      • addRmi

        void addRmi(ClientRmiInt client,
            java.lang.String nickname)
     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        The method add the new user, and send him a welcome messages. Send also a message to all the other users.
        Parameters:
        client - is the reference to the client. Necessary to communicate with it.
        nickname - of the new user
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        Parameters:

      • login

        int login(java.lang.String us,
          java.lang.String psw)
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
          java.lang.InterruptedException
        Parameters:
        us - is the username
        psw - is the password
        Returns:
        a number (0, 1, 2, 3) from the method DBUsers.login
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - for rmi connection
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • clientAlive

        boolean clientAlive(java.lang.String nickname)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
        The method checks if a certain user is connected yet. In case he is not, handle all the disconnection part.
        Parameters:
        nickname - is the user's name
        Returns:
        a boolean: true if connected, false if it's not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        message - to send
        Throws:

      • reconnectUser

        boolean reconnectUser(java.lang.String username,
                      ClientRmiInt client)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Handles all the reconnection part. Send the user to the same game (in case is playing yet).
        Parameters:
        username -
        client - client interface for connection
        Returns:
        true/false if the reconnection part worked/not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - for rmi connection

      • serverConnected

        boolean serverConnected()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        A method used by the client to "ping" the server and understand if it is online.
        Returns:
        true by default
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - for rmi connection
